title: Ticket #5932: Inefficient JobRouter location routines
description:
Several OSG sites (and CERN) have had issues with how the JobRouter locates the local batch system schedd.

Right now, we specify a pool / schedd name. That means the HTCondor-CE schedd must contact the collector & wait for a response to find the batch system schedd on this host. At CERN, we noticed this taking a lot of time and slowing things down: various other OSG sites have had issues with authentication with the collector. It's a devilishly difficult issue to track down.

This is all overkill: the batch system schedd's spool directory must be local for job tracking, so the batch system schedd ad should also be a local file.

The JobRouter should be able to take a filesystem location for a schedd ad in order to find the batch system schedd.
